an6.42:5.1: Contra BB’s “outskirts of a village”, gamanta must mean “in a village”, or perhaps “in a village neighborhood”. It is regularly contrasted with aranna, and never with plain old “gama”. I use “village district” for gamakkhetta, strictly “a village together with its fields”, and “neighborhood of a village” for gamanta.
an6.42:5.3: See BB’s note on the vll. The Chinese (SA 1250) doesn’t seem to clarify. Note that Comm says “Samādhimhā cāvessatīti samādhito uṭṭhāpessati”. Perhaps uṭṭhāpessati has been back-read into some texts, and corrupted to ghaṭessati.
